name: indebtedness
content:
indebtedness noun [U]
(MONEY OWED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the condition of owing money, or the amount of money owed: Household indebtedness is at a record level. The primary reason for the sale of the property was to reduce indebtedness.
More examplesFewer examplesYou may not want to stretch out your mortgage indebtedness another 30 years.Students are anxious to avoid long-term indebtedness. Saving is the lowest for almost 50 years and personal indebtedness is soaring.Students here have some of the highest levels of student loan indebtedness.

indebtedness noun [U]
(HELP)
a feeling of being grateful because you have been helped: The league owes a huge debt of gratitude and indebtedness to those two players. My indebtedness to persons and institutions for help in this undertaking is huge.
the fact that someone has been helped or influenced by someone or something: We acknowledge indebtedness to the researches and writings of other historians.
More examplesFewer examplesDad reflects upon his years working at the garage with a sense of indebtedness. You see the indebtedness to Pollock, Gorky, and de Kooning in her work.
